thread.title: Dashcam footage shows moment Ga. cop kills suspect
thread.title_full: Dashcam footage shows moment Ga. cop kills suspect

author: ALFRED NG
title: Dashcam footage shows moment Ga. cop kills suspect
text:
Share this URL Columbus Police Dash cam footage showed the moment a Georgia cop shot and killed a wanted suspect, who pointed a gun at the officer. 
Authorities released dashcam footage showing the moment a Georgia officer shot and killed a wanted criminal during a traffic stop. 
The Oct. 14 clip, released by the Georgia Bureau of Investigation, showed Emerson traffic officer Robert Smith stopping an SUV that cops were hunting on I-75. Brent Andrew Brannon, the driver, was wanted for trafficking heroin, marijuana and having a sawed off rifle, Columbus police said. 
Smith was alerted that the wanted gunman was armed and dangerous. He approached the car in the video, and asked Brannon to step out of the car. 
"Uhh no sir, I'm not stepping out, I'd like to know what crime you have against me," the defiant driver told Smith in the video. WSBTV The footage showed the officer firing more than a dozen bullets into the car. 
The officer told Brannon there was a warrant out for him, and opened the door, the recording shows. The suspect pointed his gun at the officer after being tased, the Georgia Bureau of Investigation said. 
The cop darts out of the way and cautiously approaches the door as he yelled, "drop the gun!" Columbus Police Department Brent Andrew Brannon, 27, of Columbus, Ohio was wanted for trafficking heroin, marijuana and having a sawed off rifle, Columbus police said. 
In the tense stand-off, the officer fires into the car, sending more than a dozen shots flying at Brannon. Moments after, listeners could hear wails of pain coming from the dying suspect. 
Smith radioed in for an ambulance and told officers that shots were fired. "He pulled a gun on me," the shaken officer told cops. 
Smith has been placed on administrative duty while the GBI looks into the shooting, officials said. Investigators found two guns inside Brannon's car after he was killed, the GBI said. 
According to Brannon's obituary , he was a U.S. army veteran who had spent four years in Afghanistan.
